summary: A series of email exchanges from March to July 2019 between SDNY prosecutors and an administrator, requesting and obtaining approval for travel to conduct victim interviews in Florida and Los Angeles for the Epstein investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips for meetings and interviews related to the enticement of minors case.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient and approver of multiple travel approval requests from SDNY prosecutors for the Epstein investigation. He grants permission for travel and conference room reservations.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Consistently copied on the travel approval request emails between the prosecutors and Edward Tyrrell.

connections.description: Both are addressed with USANYS email domains and are involved in the administrative approval process for SDNY travel related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Travel Approval for Palm Beach Interviews
events.description: Approval granted for SDNY agents to travel to Palm Beach, Florida, for victim interviews from July 10-14, 2019, including reservation of a hotel conference room.

events.title: Travel Approval for Los Angeles Interview
events.description: Approval granted for SDNY agents to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, tentatively from June 19-21, 2019, with a hotel conference room reserved.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach Meetings
events.description: Approval requested for SDNY agents to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and victim interviews, tentatively starting May 28, 2019.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach Interviews
events.description: Approval granted for SDNY prosecutors to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Interviews
events.description: SDNY prosecutors request permission to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple cities (Florida and Los Angeles) for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) between March and July 2019.
Travel requests specify the case involves "enticement of minors for sexual activity" (United States v. Epstein).
The emails show a pattern of requesting hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during these trips.
The correspondence indicates coordination among a team of prosecutors/agents, though most sender/agent names are redacted in the provided text.
Approvals were handled administratively by Edward Tyrrell (USANYS), with Michele Duncan consistently copied.
